content: The email activation instructions have been sent to the <1>{{email}}</1> email address.

comment.text: This translation key is used for the email activation instructions sent notification, which appears on a success toast after sending the email activation link. It includes a placeholder for the recipient's email address, indicating where to insert the actual email value.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Инструкциите за активиране на имейла" is a literal translation of 'email activation instructions'. A more natural Bulgarian phrasing would be 'Инструкции за активиране на акаунта/пощенската кутия'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Инструкции за активиране на акаунта/пощенската кутия бяха изпратени на имейл адрес <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'email address' is implied by 'Имейл адрес' - repeating it is redundant. A more natural and concise translation would omit the repetition.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Инструкциите за активиране бяха изпратени на <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'email activation instructions' is not accurately translated into Czech. 'Pokyny k aktivaci e-mailu' is a literal translation that sounds unnatural. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'Instrukce pro aktivaci účtu e-mailem'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Instrukce pro aktivaci účtu e-mailem

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the `<1>{{email}}</1>` tags are preserved, it's common in Czech to use the `<1>` and `</1>` consistently for variables.  Ensure this is the standard practice.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify if the <1> and </1> tags are consistently used in other translations.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation "Anleitungen zur Änderung eines Passworts wurden an <1>{{email}}</1> gesendet." translates to "Password reset instructions were sent to <1>{{email}}</1>."  The English content refers to email activation instructions, not password reset instructions.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Anleitungen zur Aktivierung wurden an <1>{{email}}</1> gesendet.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation uses "Anleitungen zur Änderung eines Passworts wurden an" instead of mirroring the English phrasing. While not a critical error, consistency with the English structure can improve clarity and maintainability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Email-Aktivierungsanleitungen wurden an <1>{{email}}</1> gesendet.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation maintains the <1>{{email}}</1> tag which is consistent with the English source, but consider if this is necessary or preferred in the Greek context. It might be more natural to remove the tags and simply insert the email address.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the tags: 'Οι οδηγίες ενεργοποίησης μέσω email έχουν σταλεί στη διεύθυνση email {{email}}'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Las instrucciones de activación se han enviado a la dirección de email <1>{{email}}</1>' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'The email activation instructions have been sent to the <1>{{email}}</1> email address.' A more natural phrasing would be something like 'Se han enviado las instrucciones de activación a la dirección de correo electrónico <1>{{email}}</1>.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Se han enviado las instrucciones de activación a la dirección de correo electrónico <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the `<1>{{email}}</1>` formatting is preserved, 'email' is translated as 'email' instead of 'correo electrónico'. While understandable, maintaining consistency would suggest translating both terms.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Se han enviado las instrucciones de activación a la dirección de correo electrónico <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Les instructions d'activation ont été envoyées à l'adresse' is not a direct or natural translation of 'The email activation instructions have been sent to the'. A more accurate translation would be 'Les instructions d'activation par e-mail ont été envoyées à'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Les instructions d'activation par e-mail ont été envoyées à

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'adresse' is acceptable, but 'adresse e-mail' is more explicit and clearer for users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: adresse e-mail

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation includes the English variable tag <1>{{email}}</1> which should be removed or localized. It is a mix of English and Armenian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the English variable tag. If localization is needed, the tag should be adjusted to be in Armenian.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While generally accurate, 'Էլփոստի ակտիվացման հրահանգներն ուղարկվել են' is a bit verbose. A more concise and natural phrasing might improve clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more concise phrasing like 'Ակտիվացման հրահանգներ ուղարկվել են Էլփոստի հասցեին' which translates to 'Activation instructions have been sent to the email address.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'via posta elettronica' (via email) is slightly more formal than necessary for this context. A simpler 'email' would be more natural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Le istruzioni per l'attivazione sono state inviate all'indirizzo email <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "電子メールによるアクティベーションの指示" is a bit literal and could be more naturally phrased. A more common and natural way to say 'email activation instructions' in Japanese would be something like "メールでの認証手続き".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: メールでの認証手続きは、

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the <1>{{email}}</1> is maintained in the translation, using full-width characters (全角文字) is generally preferred in Japanese for consistency. Consider converting the angle brackets to fullwidth.
The translation '이메일 활성화 방법이' (email activation method) is slightly awkward. A more natural translation for 'email activation instructions' would be '이메일 인증 링크' or '이메일 인증 안내'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 이메일 인증 링크가

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, '전송되었습니다' (was sent) is a bit formal. A more conversational and natural translation might be '보내드렸습니다' (we sent to you) or simply '보냈습니다' (sent).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 보내드렸습니다

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ທີ່ຢູ່ເມວ' is redundant. 'ອີເມວ' already implies an email address.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຄຳແນະນຳກ່ຽວກັບການເປີດໃຊ້ອີເມວໄດ້ຖືກສົ່ງໄປທີ່ອີເມວ <1> {{email}} </1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ເມວ' is a typo; it should be 'ອີເມວ' throughout the sentence to ensure consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຄຳແນະນຳກ່ຽວກັບການເປີດໃຊ້ອີເມວໄດ້ຖືກສົ່ງໄປທີ່ອີເມວ <1> {{email}} </1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in the Latvian translation, mirroring the English, but might not be necessary or stylistically appropriate in Latvian. While technically correct for preserving formatting tags, it's generally better to remove them unless there's a specific reason to keep them.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the `<1>` and `</1>` tags if they aren't crucial for preserving specific formatting. If they are, confirm with stakeholders if their inclusion is desirable in Latvian.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Instrukcje dotyczące aktywacji adresu e-mail zostały wysłane na adres <1>{{email}}</1>.' is a literal translation and sounds somewhat unnatural in Polish. A more natural phrasing would be 'Instrukcje aktywacji zostały wysłane na adres e-mail <1>{{email}}</1>.' or 'Wysłano instrukcje aktywacji na adres e-mail <1>{{email}}</1>.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Wysłano instrukcje aktywacji na adres e-mail <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "The email activation instructions" is better translated as "Instruções para ativar o e-mail" or "Instruções de ativação de e-mail" to sound more natural in Portuguese (Brazil). While the current translation isn't wrong, it's not the most idiomatic.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Instruções para ativar o e-mail foram enviadas para o endereço de e-mail <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Instrucțiunile de activare a adresei e-mail au fost trimise' is a bit literal and can be improved for natural Romanian flow. A more natural phrasing would be 'Instrucțiunile de activare au fost trimise'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Instrucțiunile de activare au fost trimise

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'adresei e-mail' is redundant and grammatically a little awkward. It's implied that the instructions are for an email address. Removing it makes the sentence more concise and natural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Instrucțiunile de activare au fost trimise la <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Инструкции по активации электронной почты" is a bit literal and awkward. A more natural translation would be something along the lines of "Инструкции для активации учетной записи" or "Инструкции по подтверждению адреса электронной почты".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Инструкции для активации учетной записи

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The direct translation of 'email activation instructions' sounds stiff in Russian. While technically correct, it doesn't flow as naturally as a more idiomatic expression.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Инструкции по подтверждению адреса электронной почты

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term "සක්‍රියන උපදෙස්" (Sakriyana Upades) is not the most natural translation of "email activation instructions." A more common and understandable translation would be something along the lines of "වි-තැපැල් ක්‍රියාත්මක කිරීමේ උපදෙස්" (Vi-tapel Kriyakarmakaren Upades) or "වි-තැපැල් ක්‍රියාත්මක උපදෙස්" (Vi-tapel Kriyakarmaka Upades).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: වි-තැපැල් ක්‍රියාත්මක කිරීමේ උපදෙස්

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the sentence structure could be improved for better flow in Sinhala.  The phrase "යවා ඇත" (yava atha) is a bit formal and direct in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: වි-තැපැල් ලිපිනයට යවා ඇත, යනුවෙනි.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Pokyny na aktiváciu e-mailu boli odoslané' is not the most natural way to say 'The email activation instructions have been sent'. A better translation would be 'Instrukcie na aktiváciu e-mailu boli odoslané' or 'Návod na aktiváciu e-mailu bol odoslaný'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Instrukcie na aktiváciu e-mailu boli odoslané

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, using 'e-mail' is less common in Slovak. Using 'email' would be more consistent with the English content and current usage.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: email

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'email activation instructions' is not accurately translated. 'Navodila za aktivacijo e-mail naslova' translates more literally to 'Instructions for activating the email address' rather than 'instructions for email activation'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Navodila za aktivacijo preko e-pošte so bila poslana na <1>{{email}}</1> email naslov.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The original English has `<1>{{email}}</1>`. The Slovenian translation mirrors this structure but 'email' is written in lowercase in the English. This inconsistency should be addressed to maintain formatting consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Navodila za aktivacijo e-mail naslova so bila poslana na <1>{{email}}</1> e-poštni naslov.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'postulate' (постулате) is not the correct translation for 'sent'. It implies a proposition or assumption rather than the action of sending.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Инструкције о емаил активацији су послате на <1>{{email}}</1> емаил адресу.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Cyrillic script is used inconsistently with Latin words. While 'email' is Latin, the entire phrase should be consistently adapted to Serbian, or Latin terms should be consistently transliterated.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Инструкције о емаил активацији су послате на <1>{{email}}</1> емаил адресу.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'postulate' is incorrect in this context. It means 'to propose as a hypothesis'. The intended meaning is 'sent'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Instrukcije o email aktivaciji su poslate na <1>{{email}}</1> email adresu.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The email address format in the Turkish translation is not consistent with the English. Both use the HTML tag `<1>{{email}}</1>`, but the consistency should be maintained.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the HTML tag `<1>{{email}}</1>` is consistently used in both the English and Turkish versions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Інструкції з активації електронної пошти надіслано на адресу <1>{{email}}</1>." is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'The email activation instructions have been sent to the <1>{{email}}</1> email address.'. A more accurate and natural translation would be something along the lines of 'Інструкції для активації пошти надіслано на адресу <1>{{email}}</1>.' or 'Інструкції з підтвердження електронної пошти надіслано на адресу <1>{{email}}</1>.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Інструкції для активації пошти надіслано на адресу <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The format tags <1>{{email}}</1> are preserved correctly in the Ukrainian translation, which is appropriate.

The translation '邮件激活指示已发送至<1>{{email}}</1>邮件地址' is technically correct but sounds slightly awkward. A more natural phrasing would be '我们已将激活邮件发送至<1>{{email}}</1>邮件地址' or '激活邮件已发送至<1>{{email}}</1>邮件地址。'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 激活邮件已发送至<1>{{email}}</1>邮件地址。
